newsitem.title: GREECE: ECU/DRACHMA RANGES, LONG DEPOS SOFT, BONDS FIRMER.
newsitem.headline: ECU/DRACHMA RANGES, LONG DEPOS SOFT, BONDS FIRMER.

text.p: Greek interbank depos from three-to 12-month started lower five to 10 basis points, short-term forex forwards were easier, ecu/drachma was ranging and bonds were biased on the upside, dealers said.
"Three-to 12-month depos are down about 10 basis points," said a trader at a private bank. "Short-run forex forwards are easier."
Expectations of lower inflation, interest rates and ample liquidity accounted for the drop, the dealer said.
The central bank cut its discount, Lombard and overdraft rates by 100 basis rates to 14.5 percent, 19 percent and 24 percent today.
It justified its decision on Monday by citing falling inflation and the need to bring the rates closer to interbank rates.
Bond traders said trading activity was subdued but prices had an upward bias.
The mark was quoted at 159.53/63 from Monday's 159.930 fix, the dollar at 271.39/49 drachmas from 270.500 and the ecu at 310.52/62 from 310.520 drachmas.
The central bank has signalled to the market that it does not consider the 310.50/80 level to be a ceiling and therefore it might be seen it even higher, a trader said.
